intro: Psychotria ovatistipula, commonly known as the broad-leaved psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its ovate, glossy leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Psychotria ovatistipula is also known for its role in the ecological interactions of its habitat, including associations with specific pollinators.
